Sentencas: Internally reforming anode supported solid-oxide fuel cells (SOFC) running on humidified CH4 is studied numerically.
Titulo: Numerical study of mass and heat transport in solid-oxide fuel cells running on humidified methane

Sentencas: The computational framework employs detailed multi-step models for heterogeneous chemistry for Ni catalysts.
Titulo: Numerical study of mass and heat transport in solid-oxide fuel cells running on humidified methane

Sentencas: The electrochemistry is implemented using a modified Butler-Volmer setting based on elementary charge transfer kinetics.
Titulo: Numerical study of mass and heat transport in solid-oxide fuel cells running on humidified methane

Sentencas: Transport through the porous matrix is modeled using the dusty gas model (DGM).
Titulo: Numerical study of mass and heat transport in solid-oxide fuel cells running on humidified methane

Sentencas: Parameters required for the electrochemical model are adjusted to reproduce experimentally observed data.
Titulo: Numerical study of mass and heat transport in solid-oxide fuel cells running on humidified methane

Sentencas: Obtained parameters are then used to model a co-flow planar single cell under internally reforming conditions assuming the interconnect walls as adiabatic.
Titulo: Numerical study of mass and heat transport in solid-oxide fuel cells running on humidified methane

Sentencas: Numerous runs with varying inlet conditions of cathode stream are carried out to deduce the behavior of temperature and current density distribution in the cell.
Titulo: Numerical study of mass and heat transport in solid-oxide fuel cells running on humidified methane

Sentencas: Results show that internal reforming generally leads to a temperature drop near the inlet boundary.
Titulo: Numerical study of mass and heat transport in solid-oxide fuel cells running on humidified methane
